etymologies: Middle English: via Old French from Latin thema, from Greek, literally ‘proposition’; related to tithenai ‘to set or place’

definitions: the subject of a talk, a piece of writing, a person's thoughts, or an exhibition; a topic

examples.text: the theme of the sermon was reverence
a show on the theme of waste and recycling

shortDefinitions: subject of talk, piece of writing

definitions: the first major constituent of a clause, indicating the subject-matter, typically being the subject but optionally other constituents, as in “poor he is not.”.
an essay written by a student on an assigned subject.
shortDefinitions: essay written by school pupil on particular subject

definitions: an idea that recurs in or pervades a work of art or literature

examples.text: love and honor are the pivotal themes of the Hornblower books

shortDefinitions: idea that recurs in or pervades work of art or literature

definitions: a prominent or frequently recurring melody or group of notes in a composition

examples.text: the first violin takes up the theme high up in its register

shortDefinitions: prominent or frequently recurring melody or group of notes in composition

definitions: (of music) frequently recurring in or accompanying the beginning and end of a film, play, or musical
shortDefinitions: piece of music that frequently recurs in or accompanies beginning and end of film

definitions: a setting given to a leisure venue or activity, intended to evoke a particular country, historical period, culture, etc.

examples.text: a family fun park with a western theme

shortDefinitions: setting given to restaurant, pub, or leisure venue, intended to evoke particular country, historical period

definitions: the stem of a noun or verb; the part to which inflections are added, especially one composed of the root and an added vowel.
any of the twenty-nine provinces in the Byzantine empire.
shortDefinitions: any of twenty-nine provinces in Byzantine empire

definitions: give a particular setting or ambience to (a venue or activity)

examples.text: the amusement park will be themed as a Caribbean pirate stronghold

shortDefinitions: give particular theme or setting to
